1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdPath.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The path manipulation routines. Much of the heart of **
14   |  **			Modules is contained in this file. These routines    **
15   |  **			are responsible for adding and removing directories  **
16   |  **			from given PATH-like variables.			     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		cmdSetPath					     **
19   |  **			cmdRemovePath					     **
20   |  ** 									     **
21   |  **   Notes:								     **
22   |  ** 									     **
23   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
24   |  ****/
25   | 
26   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
27   |  ** 									     **
28   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
29   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
30   |  ** 									     ** 
31   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
32   | 
33   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdPath.c.src.html,v 1.6.30.1 2010/11/11 18:23:20 rkowen Exp $";
34   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
35   | 
36   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
37   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
38   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
39   | 
40   | #include "modules_def.h"
41   | #ifdef	HAS_SYS_PARAM_H
42   | #include <sys/param.h>
43   | #endif
44   | 
45   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
46   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
47   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
48   | 
49   | /** not applicable **/
50   | 
51   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
52   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
54   | 
55   | #ifdef	MAXPATHLEN
56   | #define	PATH_BUFLEN	MAXPATHLEN
57   | #else
58   | #define	PATH_BUFLEN	1024
59   | #endif
60   | 
61   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
62   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
63   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
64   | 
65   | #define _TCLCHK(a)	\
66   | 	{if (*(TCL_RESULT(a))) ErrorLogger(ERR_EXEC,LOC,TCL_RESULT(a),NULL);}
67   | 
68   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
69   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
70   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
71   | 
72   | static	char	module_name[] = "cmdPath.c";	/** File name of this module **/
73   | 
74   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
75   | static	char	_proc_cmdSetPath[] = "cmdSetPath";
76   | static	char	_proc_cmdRemovePath[] = "cmdRemovePath";
77   | static	char	_proc_Remove_Path[] = "Remove_Path";
78   | #endif
79   | 
80   | static char buffer[ PATH_BUFLEN];
81   | 
82   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
83   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
84   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
85   | 
86   | static int	Remove_Path( Tcl_Interp	*interp, char *variable, char *item, 
87   | 			char *sw_marker, const char *delim);
88   | 
89   | 
90   | /*++++
91   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
92   |  ** 									     **
93   |  **   Function:		cmdSetPath					     **
94   |  ** 									     **
95   |  **   Description:	Add the passed value (argv[2]) to the specified vari-**
96   |  **			able (argv[1]). argv[0] specifies, if the variable   **
97   |  **			is to be appended or prepended.  Each directory in   **
98   |  **			the path is checked to see whether it is already     **
99   |  **			in the path.  If so it is not added.		     **
100  |  **			(Handles options -d C, or --delim[=]C )		     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
105  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
106  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
107  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
108  |  ** 									     **
109  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
110  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
111  |  ** 									     **
112  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
113  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
114  |  **					control everything		     **
115  |  ** 									     **
116  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
117  |  ++++*/
118  | 
119  | int	cmdSetPath(	ClientData	 client_data,
120  | 	       		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
121  | 	       		int		 argc,
122  | 	       		CONST84 char	*argv[])
123  | {
124  |     Tcl_RegExp	chkexpPtr;			/** Regular expression for   **/
125  | 						/** marker checking	     **/
126  |     char	 *oldpath,			/** Old value of 'var'	     **/
127  | 		 *newpath,			/** New value of 'var'	     **/
128  | 		 *sw_marker = APP_SW_MARKER,	/** arbitrary default	     **/
129  | 		 *startp=NULL, *endp=NULL,	/** regexp match endpts	     **/
130  | 		 *qualifiedpath,		/** List of dirs which 
131  | 						    aren't already in path   **/
132  | 		**pathlist;			/** List of dirs	     **/
133  |     const char	 *delim = _colon;		/** path delimiter	     **/
134  |     int		  append = 1,			/** append or prepend	     **/
135  | 		  numpaths,			/** number of dirs in path   **/
136  | 		  qpathlen,			/** qualifiedpath length     **/
137  | 		  arg1 = 1,			/** arg start		     **/
138  | 		  x;				/** loop index		     **/
139  | 
140  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
141  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdSetPath, NULL);
142  | #endif
143  | 
144  |     /**
145  |      **  Whatis mode?
146  |      **/
147  |     if( g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
148  |         goto success0;
149  | 	
150  |     /**
151  |      **   Check arguments. There should be at least 3 args:
152  |      **     argv[0]  -  prepend/append
153  |      **     ...
154  |      **     argv[n-1]-  varname
155  |      **     argv[n]  -  value
156  |      **/
157  |     if(argc < 3)
158  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0],
159  | 	    " path-variable directory", NULL))
160  | 	    goto unwind0;
161  | 
162  |     /**
163  |      **  Should this guy be removed from the variable ... If yes, do so!
164  |      **/
165  |     if(g_flags & M_REMOVE) 
166  | 	return( cmdRemovePath(client_data, interp, argc, argv));   /** ----> **/
167  | 
168  |     /**
169  |      **  prepend or append. The default is append.
170  |      **/
171  |     if( !( append = !!strncmp( argv[0], "pre", 3)))
172  | 	sw_marker = PRE_SW_MARKER;
173  |   
174  |     /**
175  |      **  Non-persist mode?
176  |      **/
177  |     
178  |     if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
179  | 	return (TCL_OK);
180  |     }
181  | 
182  |     /**
183  |      **  Display only ... ok, let's do so!
184  |      **/
185  |     if(g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
186  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s\t ", argv[ 0]);
187  | 	while( --argc)
188  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s ", *++argv);
189  | 	fprintf( stderr, "\n");
190  |         goto success0;
191  |     }
192  | 
193  |     /**
194  |      **  Check for the delimiter option
195  |      **/
196  |     if(*(argv[arg1]) == '-') {
197  | 	if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "-d")) {
198  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
199  | 		arg1 += 2;
200  | 	} else if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "--delim")) {
201  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
202  | 		arg1 += 2;
203  | 	} else if (!strncmp(argv[arg1], "--delim=", 8)) {
204  | 		delim = argv[arg1]+8;
205  | 		arg1++;
206  | 	}
207  |     }
208  | 
209  |     /**
210  |      **  Get the old value of the variable. MANPATH defaults to a configure
211  |      **  generated value.
212  |      **  Put a \ in front of each '.' and '+'.
213  |      **  (this is an intentional memory leak)
214  |      **/
215  |     oldpath = (char *) Tcl_GetVar2( interp, "env", argv[arg1], TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
216  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
217  | 
218  |     if( oldpath == NULL)
219  | 	oldpath = !strcmp( argv[arg1], "MANPATH") ? DEFAULTMANPATH : "";
220  | 
221  |     /**
222  |      **  Split the new path into its components directories so each
223  |      **  directory can be checked to see whether it is already in the 
224  |      **  existing path.
225  |      **/
226  |     if( !( pathlist = SplitIntoList( interp, (char *) argv[arg1+1], &numpaths,
227  | 	delim)))
228  | 	goto unwind0;
229  | 
230  |     /**
231  |      **  Some space for the list of paths which
232  |      **  are not already in the existing path.
233  |      **/
234  |     if((char *) NULL == (qualifiedpath = stringer(NULL,0, argv[arg1+1],
235  | 	delim, NULL)))
236  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
237  | 	    goto unwind1;
238  | 
239  |     qpathlen = strlen(qualifiedpath)+1;
240  |     *qualifiedpath = '\0';		/** make sure null for later	     **/
241  | 
242  |     for( x = 0; x < numpaths; x++) {
243  | 
244  | 	cleanse_path( pathlist[x], buffer, PATH_BUFLEN);
245  | 
246  | 	/**
247  | 	 **  Check to see if path is already in this path variable.
248  | 	 **  It could be at the 
249  | 	 **     beginning ... ^path:
250  | 	 **     middle    ... :path:
251  | 	 **     end       ... :path$
252  | 	 **     only one  ... ^path$
253  | 	 **/
254  | 	if((char *) NULL == (newpath = stringer(NULL,0,
255  | 		"(^", buffer, delim, ")|(",delim, buffer, delim,")|(",delim,
256  | 		buffer, "$)|(^", buffer, "$)",NULL)))
257  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
258  | 		goto unwind2;
259  | 
260  | 	chkexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, newpath);
261  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
262  | 	null_free((void *) &newpath);
263  | 
264  | 	/**
265  | 	 **  If the directory is not already in the path, 
266  | 	 **  add it to the qualified path.
267  | 	 **/
268  | 	if( !Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, chkexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath))
269  | 	    if ((char *) NULL ==
270  | 		    stringer(qualifiedpath + strlen(qualifiedpath),
271  | 		    qpathlen - strlen(qualifiedpath),
272  | 		    pathlist[x], delim, NULL))
273  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
274  | 		    goto unwind2;
275  | 
276  |     }					/** End of loop that checks for 
277  | 					 ** already existent path
278  | 					 **/
279  |     /**
280  |      **  If all of the directories in the new path already exist,
281  |      **  exit doing nothing.
282  |      **/
283  |     if( ! *qualifiedpath)
284  | 	goto success1;
285  | 
286  |     /* remove trailing delimiter */
287  |     qualifiedpath[strlen(qualifiedpath) - 1] = '\0';
288  | 
289  |     /**
290  |      **  Some space for our newly created path.
291  |      **  We size at the oldpath plus the addition.
292  |      **/
293  |     if((char *)NULL == (newpath = stringer(NULL, strlen( oldpath) +
294  | 	strlen(qualifiedpath) + 2,NULL)))
295  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
296  | 	    goto unwind2;
297  |     *newpath = '\0';
298  | 
299  |     /**
300  |      **  Easy job to do, if the old path has not been set up so far ...
301  |      **/
302  |     if( !strcmp( oldpath, "")) {
303  | 	strcpy( newpath, qualifiedpath);
304  | 
305  |     /**
306  |      **  Otherwise we have to take care on prepending vs. appending ...
307  |      **  If there is a append or prepend marker within the variable (see
308  |      **  modules_def.h) the changes are made according to this markers. Other-
309  |      **  wise append and prepend will be relative to the strings begin or end.
310  |      **/
311  | 
312  |     } else {
313  | 
314  | 	Tcl_RegExp	markexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, sw_marker);
315  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
316  | 
317  | 	strcpy( newpath, oldpath);
318  | 
319  | 	if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, markexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath)) {
320  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp)
321  | 	    Tcl_RegExpRange(markexpPtr, 0,
322  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
323  | 
324  | 	    /**
325  | 	     **  Append/Prepend marker found
326  | 	     **/
327  | 	    if( append) {
328  | 		char ch = *startp;
329  | 		*startp = '\0';
330  | 		strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
331  |                 /**
332  |                  ** check that newpath has a value before adding delim
333  |                  **/
334  | 		if (strlen(newpath) > 0 && newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
335  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
336  | 		strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
337  | 		if (newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
338  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
339  | 		*startp = ch;
340  | 		strcat(newpath, startp);
341  |                
342  | 	    } else {
343  |                 char ch = *endp;
344  | 		*endp = '\0';
345  | 		strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
346  | 		if (newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
347  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
348  | 		strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
349  | 		*endp = ch;
350  | 		strcat(newpath, endp);
351  | 	    }
352  | 
353  | 	} else {
354  | 
355  | 	    /**
356  | 	     **  No marker set
357  | 	     **/
358  | 	    if( !append) {
359  | 		strcpy(newpath, qualifiedpath);
360  | 		if (*oldpath != *delim)	strcat(newpath, delim);
361  | 		strcat(newpath, oldpath);
362  | 	    } else {
363  | 		strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
364  | 		if (newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
365  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
366  | 		strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
367  | 	    }
368  | 
369  | 	} /** if( marker) **/
370  | 
371  |     } /** if( strcmp) **/
372  | 
373  |     /**
374  |      **  Now the new value to be set resides in 'newpath'. Set it up.
375  |      **/
376  |     moduleSetenv( interp, (char *) argv[arg1], newpath, 1);
377  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
378  | 
379  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
380  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdSetPath, NULL);
381  | #endif
382  | 
383  |     /**
384  |      ** Free resources
385  |      **/
386  |     null_free((void *) &newpath);
387  | success1:
388  |     null_free((void *) &qualifiedpath);
389  |     FreeList( pathlist, numpaths);
390  | success0:
391  |     return( TCL_OK);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
392  | 
393  | unwind2:
394  |     null_free((void *) &qualifiedpath);
395  | unwind1:
396  |     FreeList( pathlist, numpaths);
397  | unwind0:
398  |     return( TCL_ERROR);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
399  | 
400  | } /** End of 'cmdSetPath' **/
401  | 
402  | /*++++
403  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
404  |  ** 									     **
405  |  **   Function:		cmdRemovePath					     **
406  |  ** 									     **
407  |  **   Description:	Remove the passed value (argv[2]) from the specified **
408  |  **			variable (argv[1]). In case of switching this pro-   **
409  |  **			cedure removes markers from the path, too. argv[0]   **
410  |  **			specifies, if the append- or prepend-marker is af-   **
411  |  **			fected						     **
412  |  ** 									     **
413  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
414  |  ** 									     **
415  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
416  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
417  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
418  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
419  |  ** 									     **
420  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
421  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
422  |  ** 									     **
423  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
424  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
425  |  **					control everything		     **
426  |  ** 									     **
427  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
428  |  ++++*/
429  | 
430  | int	cmdRemovePath(	ClientData	 client_data,
431  | 	       		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
432  | 	       		int		 argc,
433  | 	       		CONST84 char	*argv[])
434  | {
435  |     char	 *sw_marker = APP_SW_MARKER,	/** arbitrary default	     **/
436  | 		**pathlist;			/** List of dirs	     **/
437  |     const char	 *delim = _colon;		/** path delimiter	     **/
438  |     int		  numpaths,			/** number of dirs in path   **/
439  | 		  arg1 = 1,			/** arg start		     **/
440  | 		  x;				/** loop index		     **/
441  | 
442  | 
443  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
444  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdRemovePath, NULL);
445  | #endif
446  | 
447  |     /**
448  |      **   Check arguments. There should be give 3 args:
449  |      **     argv[0]  -  prepend/append/remove-path
450  |      **     ...
451  |      **     argv[n-1]-  varname
452  |      **     argv[n]  -  value
453  |      **/
454  |     if(argc < 3)
455  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE,LOC,argv[0],"path-variable directory",
456  | 	    NULL))
457  | 	    goto unwind0;
458  | 
459  |   
460  |     /**
461  |      **  Non-persist mode?
462  |      **/
463  |     
464  |     if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
465  | 	return (TCL_OK);
466  |     }
467  | 
468  |     /**
469  |      **  Display only ... ok, let's do so!
470  |      **/
471  |     if(g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
472  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s\t ", argv[ 0]);
473  | 	while( --argc)
474  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s ", *++argv);
475  | 	fprintf( stderr, "\n");
476  |         goto success0;
477  |     }
478  |   
479  |     /**
480  |      **  prepend or append. The default is append.
481  |      **/
482  |     if( ! strncmp( argv[0], "pre", 3))
483  | 	sw_marker = PRE_SW_MARKER;
484  |   
485  |     /**
486  |      ** For switch state3, we're looking to remove the markers.
487  |      **/
488  |     if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE3) 
489  | 	argv[arg1+1] = sw_marker;
490  | 
491  |     /**
492  |      **  Check for the delimiter option
493  |      **/
494  |     if(*(argv[arg1]) == '-') {
495  | 	if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "-d")) {
496  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
497  | 		arg1 += 2;
498  | 	} else if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "--delim")) {
499  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
500  | 		arg1 += 2;
501  | 	} else if (!strncmp(argv[arg1], "--delim=", 8)) {
502  | 		delim = argv[arg1]+8;
503  | 		arg1++;
504  | 	}
505  |     }
506  | 
507  |     /**
508  |      **  Split the path into its components so each item can be removed
509  |      **  individually from the variable.
510  |      **/
511  |     if( !( pathlist = SplitIntoList( interp, (char *) argv[arg1+1], &numpaths,
512  | 	delim)))
513  | 	goto unwind0;
514  | 
515  |     /**
516  |      ** Remove each item individually
517  |      **/
518  |     for( x = 0; x < numpaths; x++)
519  | 	if(TCL_OK != Remove_Path(interp,(char *) argv[arg1],pathlist[x],
520  | 	sw_marker, delim))
521  | 	    goto unwind1;
522  | 
523  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
524  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdRemovePath, NULL);
525  | #endif
526  | 
527  |     /**
528  |      ** Free resources
529  |      **/
530  |     FreeList(pathlist, numpaths);
531  | 
532  | success0:
533  |     return( TCL_OK);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
534  | 
535  | unwind1:
536  |     FreeList(pathlist, numpaths);
537  | unwind0:
538  |     return( TCL_ERROR);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
539  | 
540  | } /** End of 'cmdRemovePath' **/
541  | 
542  | /*++++
543  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
544  |  ** 									     **
545  |  **   Function:		Remove_Path					     **
546  |  ** 									     **
547  |  **   Description:	This function actually does the work of removing     **
548  |  **			the item from the path.  It is done this way to      **
549  |  **			support multiple items (often directories)	     **
550  |  **			separated by colons in the variable value.	     **
551  |  ** 									     **
552  |  **   First Edition:	2001/08/08					     **
553  |  ** 									     **
554  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
555  |  **			char		*variable	Variable from which  **
556  |  **							to remove item	     **
557  |  **			char		*item		Item to remove	     **
558  |  **			char		*sw_marker	Switch marker	     **
559  |  **			const char	*delim		path delimiter	     **
560  |  ** 									     **
561  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
562  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
563  |  ** 									     **
564  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
565  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
566  |  **					control everything		     **
567  |  ** 									     **
568  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
569  |  ++++*/
570  | 
571  | static int	Remove_Path(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
572  | 	       			char		*variable,
573  | 	       			char		*item,
574  | 				char		*sw_marker,
575  | 				const char	*delim)
576  | {
577  |     char	*oldpath,			/** Old value of 'var'	     **/
578  |     		*tmppath,			/** Temp. buffer for 'var'   **/
579  |     		*searchpath,
580  | 		*startp=NULL, *endp=NULL;	/** regexp match endpts	     **/
581  |     int  	 start_offset = 0,		/** match offsets	     **/
582  |     		 end_offset = 0,
583  | 		 path_len = 0;			/** length of unmatched path **/
584  |     Tcl_RegExp	regexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
585  |     		begexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
586  |     		midexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
587  |     		endexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
588  |     		onlyexpPtr = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
589  |     		markexpPtr = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL;
590  | 
591  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
592  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Remove_Path, NULL);
593  | #endif
594  | 
595  |     /**
596  |      **  Get the current value of the "PATH" environment variable
597  |      **/
598  |     if( NULL == (tmppath = (char *) Tcl_GetVar2( interp, "env", variable,
599  | 	TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY))) {
600  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
601  | 	return( TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
602  |     }    
603  | 
604  |     /**
605  |      **  We want to make a local copy of old path because we're going
606  |      **  to be butchering it and the environ one doesn't need to be
607  |      **  changed in this manner.
608  |      **  Put a \ in front of each . and + in the passed value to remove.
609  |      **/
610  |     if((char *) NULL == (oldpath = stringer(NULL,0, tmppath, NULL)))
611  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
612  | 	    goto unwind0;
613  |     path_len = strlen(oldpath);
614  |     cleanse_path( item, buffer, PATH_BUFLEN);
615  | 
616  |     /**
617  |      **  Now we need to find it in the path variable.  So, we create
618  |      **  space enough to build search expressions.
619  |      **/
620  |     if((char *) NULL == (searchpath = stringer(NULL,0,"^", buffer,
621  | 	delim, NULL)))
622  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
623  | 	    goto unwind1;
624  | 
625  |     /**
626  |      **  This section searches for the oldpath in the PATH variable.
627  |      **  There are four cases because the colons must be used as markers
628  |      **  in order to guarantee that a partial match isn't being found.
629  |      ** 
630  |      **  The start_offset and end_offset variables indicate how much to 
631  |      **  cut or not to cut off of each end of the located
632  |      **  string.  They differ for each case...beginning of
633  |      **  the path, middle of the path, end of the path, 
634  |      **  and for the only path.
635  |      ** 
636  |      **  This is to ensure the colons get cut off properly.
637  |      **/
638  | 
639  |     begexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp,  searchpath);
640  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
641  | 
642  |     if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, begexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
643  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
644  | 	regexpPtr = begexpPtr;
645  | 
646  | 	/**
647  | 	 **  Copy from the beginning of the startp to one
648  | 	 **  character before endp
649  | 	 **/
650  | 
651  | 	Tcl_RegExpRange(begexpPtr, 0,
652  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
653  | 	start_offset = 0; end_offset = -1;
654  | 	path_len -= (endp - startp - 1);
655  | 
656  |     } else {
657  | 
658  | 	*searchpath = *delim;	/* :buffer: */
659  | 	midexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
660  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
661  | 
662  | 	if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, midexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
663  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp)
664  | 	    regexpPtr = midexpPtr;
665  | 
666  | 	    /**
667  | 	     **  Copy from one character after stringp[0] to one
668  | 	     **  character before endp[0]
669  | 	     **/
670  | 
671  | 	    Tcl_RegExpRange(midexpPtr, 0,
672  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
673  | 	    start_offset = 1; end_offset = -1;
674  | 	    path_len -= (endp - startp - 2);
675  | 
676  | 	} else {
677  | 
678  | 	    searchpath[strlen(searchpath)-1] = '$';	/* :buffer$ */
679  | 	    endexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
680  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp)
681  | 
682  | 	    if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, endexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
683  | 		_TCLCHK(interp)
684  | 		regexpPtr = endexpPtr;
685  | 
686  | 		/**
687  | 		 **  Copy from one character after stringp[0] 
688  | 		 **  through endp[0]
689  | 		 **/
690  | 
691  | 		Tcl_RegExpRange(endexpPtr, 0,
692  | 			(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
693  | 		start_offset = 0; end_offset = 0;
694  | 		path_len -= (endp - startp - 1);
695  | 
696  | 	    } else {
697  | 
698  | 		*searchpath = '^';	/* ^buffer$ */
699  | 		onlyexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
700  | 		_TCLCHK(interp)
701  | 
702  | 		if(Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, onlyexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
703  | 		    _TCLCHK(interp)
704  | 
705  | 		    /**
706  | 		     **  In this case, I should go ahead and unset the variable
707  | 		     **  from the environment because I'm removing the very last
708  | 		     **  path.
709  | 		     **
710  | 		     **  First I'm going to clear the variable from the
711  | 		     **  setenvHashTable just in case its already been altered
712  | 		     **  and had a significant value at the time. It's very
713  | 		     **  possible that I'm removing the only two or three paths
714  | 		     **  from this variable. If that's the case, then all the
715  | 		     **  earlier paths were marked for output in this hashTable.
716  | 		     **
717  | 		     **  Secondly, I actually mark the the environment variable
718  | 		     **  to be unset when output.
719  | 		     **/
720  | 		    clear_hash_value( setenvHashTable, variable);
721  | 		    moduleUnsetenv( interp, variable);
722  | 
723  | 		    /**
724  | 		     **  moduleUnsetenv doesn't unset the variable in the Tcl
725  | 		     **  space because the $env variable might need to be
726  | 		     **  used again in the modulefile for locating other
727  | 		     **  paths.  BUT, since this was a path-type environment
728  | 		     **  variable, the user is expecting this to be empty
729  | 		     **  after removing the only remaining path.  So, I set
730  | 		     **  the variable empty here.
731  | 		     **/
732  | 		    (void) Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, "",
733  | 			TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
734  | 		    _TCLCHK(interp)
735  | 		    null_free((void *) &searchpath);
736  | 		    goto success1;
737  | 		}
738  | 	    }
739  | 	}
740  |     }
741  |     null_free((void *) &searchpath);
742  | 
743  |     /**
744  |      **  If I couldn't find it assume it wasn't there
745  |      **  and return.
746  |      **/
747  |     if( !regexpPtr)
748  | 	goto success1;
749  | 
750  |     markexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, sw_marker);
751  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
752  | 
753  |     /**
754  |      **  In state1, we're actually replacing old paths with
755  |      **  the markers for future appends and prepends.
756  |      **  
757  |      **  We only want to do this once to mark the location
758  |      **  the module was formed around.
759  |      **/
760  |     if((g_flags & M_SWSTATE1) && ! (Tcl_RegExpExec(interp,
761  | 	 markexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0)) {
762  | 
763  | 	/**
764  | 	 **  If I don't have enough space to replace the oldpath with the
765  | 	 **  marker, then I must create space for the marker and thus
766  | 	 **  recreate the PATH variable.
767  | 	 **/
768  | 	char* newenv;
769  | 	int newlen = path_len + strlen(sw_marker) + 1;
770  |       
771  | 	if((char *) NULL==(newenv = stringer(NULL, newlen ,NULL) ))
772  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
773  | 		goto unwind1;
774  | 
775  | 	*(startp + start_offset) = '\0';
776  | 
777  | 	if(*(endp + end_offset) == '\0') {
778  | 	    (void) stringer(newenv, newlen, oldpath,delim,sw_marker,NULL);
779  | 	} else {
780  | 	    (void) stringer(newenv, newlen, oldpath,sw_marker,
781  | 		endp + end_offset, NULL);
782  | 	}
783  | 
784  | 	/**
785  | 	 **  Just store the value with the marker into the environment.  I'm not
786  | 	 **  checking if it changed because the only case that a PATH-type
787  | 	 **  variable will be unset is when I remove the only path remaining in
788  | 	 **  the variable.  So, using moduleSetenv is not necessary here.
789  | 	 **/
790  | 	Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, newenv, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
791  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
792  | 	null_free((void *) &newenv);
793  | 
794  |     } else {  /** SW_STATE1 **/
795  | 
796  | 	/**
797  | 	 **  We must be in SW_STATE3 or not in SW_STATE at all.
798  | 	 **  Removing the marker should be just like removing any other path.
799  | 	 **/
800  | 	strcpy( startp + start_offset, endp);
801  | 
802  | 	/**
803  | 	 **  Cache the set.  Clear the variable from the unset table just
804  | 	 **  in case it was previously unset.
805  | 	 **/
806  | 	store_hash_value( setenvHashTable, variable, oldpath);
807  | 	clear_hash_value( unsetenvHashTable, variable);
808  | 
809  | 	/**
810  | 	 **  Store the new PATH value into the environment.
811  | 	 **/
812  | 	Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, oldpath, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
813  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
814  | 
815  |     }  /** ! SW_STATE1 **/
816  | 
817  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
818  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdRemovePath, NULL);
819  | #endif
820  | 
821  |     /**
822  |      **  Free what has been used and return on success
823  |      **/
824  | success1:
825  |     null_free((void *) &oldpath);
826  | success0:
827  |     return( TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
828  | 
829  | unwind1:
830  |     null_free((void *) &oldpath);
831  | unwind0:
832  |     return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
833  | 
834  | } /** End of 'Remove_Path' **/
